intro: Cheiranthus pulchellus, commonly known as the pretty candytuft, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape. Its flowers, which are white or pale pink, bloom in clusters during the spring and early summer. The plant is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
